info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 4:56PM MDT until August 18 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of south central New Mexico, including the following county, Dona Ana and western Texas, including the following county, El Paso.
* WHEN...Until 800 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 456 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly around UTEP and Central El Paso. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - UTEP and Central El Paso is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall of up to 0.5 inches is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... West El Paso, Central El Paso, Northeast El Paso, Sunland Park and Franklin Mountains State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Dona Ana, NM; El Paso, TX
